TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Rutabaga22 said:
> 
> 
> Why do y'all write [Snip] instead of just removing things from posts/comments?
> 

To indicate where stuff was removed.

> 
> 
> 8 minutes ago, Rutabaga22 said:
> 
> 
> Why do y'all write [Snip] instead of just removing things from posts/comments?
> 

That's a great question! It's because we don't want people to wonder what happened to their content. If something gets removed or edited, the poster will always be informed in some way, either with something like "[snip],", like you mention, or via a PM etc.
And as a side effect, it helps the user to understand what sort of content may not be in line with the forum guidelines.

We are occasionally accused of being sneaky secret censors, so we make an effort to be as open as we can about what we do, without violating the privacy of the people involved. The [snip] notation shows a person exactly where we removed something from her/his post, without telling bystanders what it was we removed. 

By the way, do not assume that the [snip] notation indicates that the person did something wrong. Sometimes it's merely an indication that this person quoted something else which really was a problem.

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> By the way, do not assume that the [snip] notation indicates that the person did something wrong. Sometimes it's merely an indication that this person quoted something else which really was a problem.
> 

I often use it when quoting a long post just to comment on parts of it.
Do y'all get extra ksp2 info?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Rutabaga22 said:
> 
> 
> Do y'all get extra ksp2 info?
> 

No
Not even a little bit.
![crying-not-even-at-all.gif](https://c.tenor.com/gCxBYIcRBqkAAAAC/crying-not-even-at-all.gif)

> 
> 
> On 8/28/2022 at 11:45 AM, Rutabaga22 said:
> 
> 
> Do y'all get extra ksp2 info?
> 

Nope.  And not only don't we get extra KSP 2 info, we really don't get any "extra info" at *<u>all</u>*, about anything the company does.  For example, back when original KSP was under active development, we found out about new version releases, or new DLCs, at the same time as everyone else-- we don't get advanced notice.  In general, we never get any info about the internal development of KSP (or KSP2) other than what the public forum gets.

This is because we're *<u>not employees</u>*, so (among other things) it means we're not subject to the same NDAs that an employee would be.  (We do have NDAs, but they're different ones, relating to moderating rather than development.)  Companies need to play their cards close to the chest.  The only "secret stuff" that we can see (that you can't) is stuff directly relating to the *<u>forum users</u>* (e.g. things like a user's history of warnings and the like)-- basically, just the stuff that we need to be able to do our job as moderators.

Beyond that... we never know anything beyond what you do, and we generally find stuff out in the same way that you do. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

> 
>

> 
> 
> Why do y'all write [Snip] instead of just removing things from posts/comments?
> 

It's a moderator's scythe sound effect.
